column2: ,fix(reported_content): sanitize report URLs,vuln-fix: Normalize URL to Prevent Open Redirects (CWE-601)

column1: An open redirect vulnerability exists due to improper handling of unvalidated URLs.
This poses a significant security risk as attackers could exploit it to redirect users to malicious sites.
The issue was fixed by normalizing the site URL before assigning it to the report's address.
Co-authored-by: John Linhart <admin@escope.cz>","vuln-fix: Escape User-Agent to Prevent XSS (CWE-79)
The application did not properly escape user input in the User-Agent field.
This oversight could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts, leading to potential cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
This vulnerability was addressed by utilizing an escape function on the User-Agent output.
Weakness: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation
print('<div class=""tag-management-form generalbox""><label class=""accesshide"" for=""id_tagfilter"">'. get_string('search') .'</label>'.

get_string('resetfilter', 'tag'), array('class' => 'resetfilterlink')) : '').",MDL-69340 tag: Correct the filter input HTML in the tag manager,"vuln-fix: Fix HTML injection in tag filter input (CWE-79)

The previous code allowed unescaped user input to be rendered in the HTML output. This is a security risk as it may allow attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or scripts into the page, leading to potential cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. The vulnerability was mitigated by ensuring that the user input is properly escaped before being included in the HTML output.
Weakness: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (CWE-79)

refactor escape entities for better type checking","vuln-fix: Prevent Object and Array Escaping Issues (CWE-20)

The function escapeEntities previously mishandled various object types, particularly undefined and empty arrays. If not correctly processed, this could lead to unintended application behavior, including potential exposure of sensitive data. Modifications were made to ensure that only valid types are processed, returning clear indications for empty arrays and objects without exposing their contents.

The modification introduces 'aspx' to the list of dangerous file extensions. This extension posed a risk for potential file inclusion attacks due to insecure file handling. The fix was implemented by explicitly adding 'aspx' to the array of blocked extensions.
Weakness: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory
